abstract: A new bloc of large growth markets may arguably divert billions of investment, but smaller markets with better governance could offer investors higher long-term returns.
snippet: A new bloc of large growth markets may arguably divert billions of investment, but smaller markets with better governance could offer investors higher long-term returns.
lead_paragraph: The BRIC acronym for the world’s biggest emerging economies, created by the Goldman Sachs economist Jim O’Neill a decade ago, became a somewhat self-fulfilling prophecy. It arguably diverted billions of investment from elsewhere to his chosen markets of Brazil, Russia, India and China.

byline.original: By Martin Hutchinson and Agnes T. Crane

abstract: Standard Chartered says it has agreed to buy GE Money, an auto and personal loan company in Singapore, for an undisclosed sum.
snippet: Standard Chartered says it has agreed to buy GE Money, an auto and personal loan company in Singapore, for an undisclosed sum.
lead_paragraph: Standard Chartered said on Monday that it had agreed to buy GE Money Pte. Ltd., an auto and personal loan company in Singapore, for an undisclosed sum.

headline.main: Standard Chartered to Buy Singapore Unit of G.E.
